Notes: DHA-licensed city. Shared accommodation in areas like International City, Discovery Gardens. Public transport via Metro/Bus (Nol Card ~AED 350/month). Basic grocery shopping at Carrefour/Lulu. Healthcare covered by employer-mandated insurance.
1BHK in outer areas (JVC, Sports City, Dubai Silicon Oasis). DEWA utilities average for 1-person household. Groceries include some dining at budget restaurants (AED 20-30/meal).
2-3BHK in family-friendly areas (Discovery Gardens, Mirdif). Utilities for family of 3-4. Transport includes occasional taxis. Groceries for family cooking at home.
Better-located shared accommodation (JLT, Barsha). Mix of public transport and occasional taxis/Careem. More dining out and social activities. Higher quality groceries.
1BHK in mid-tier locations (JLT, Barsha, Motor City). Balanced lifestyle with regular dining out (2-3 times/week). Choithrams/Spinneys grocery shopping. Entertainment budget included.
2-3BHK in popular expat areas (JBR, Marina, Mirdif). Family car ownership or frequent taxi use. Weekend activities, dining out 3-4 times/month. Children's activities included in misc.
Premium shared accommodation (Downtown, Marina, JBR). Frequent dining and entertainment. Waitrose/Organic Foods grocery shopping. Gym membership, weekend activities.

Luxury 1BHK in prime locations (Downtown Dubai, Marina, Business Bay). High-end lifestyle with regular fine dining. Car ownership or unlimited taxi budget. Premium groceries, entertainment subscriptions.

Premium 3-4BHK in luxury developments (Palm Jumeirah, Emirates Hills, Downtown). International school fees NOT included (add AED 40,000-100,000/year per child). Two cars or extensive taxi use. Regular fine dining, weekend trips, clubs/activities.
DOH-licensed emirate. Shared accommodation in Khalifa City, Mussafah. Public bus network less extensive than Dubai. Groceries at Lulu, Al Maya. Healthcare covered by employer insurance.
1BHK in outer areas (Khalifa City, Al Reef, Mussafah). Lower transport costs due to less traffic/shorter distances. Similar cost structure to Dubai Basic but higher base rents.
2-3BHK in family areas (Khalifa City, Al Raha). Car typically necessary for families in Abu Dhabi (limited public transport). Family groceries at wholesale centers.
Shared accommodation in better locations (Al Reem Island, Electra). Mix of public transport and taxis. More dining and social activities than Basic tier.
1BHK in mid-tier areas (Al Reem Island, Al Raha Beach, Tourist Club). Balanced lifestyle with regular dining out. Spinneys/Waitrose shopping. Entertainment included.
2-3BHK in family-friendly developments (Al Raha Beach, Yas Island, Reem Island). Family car essential. Weekend activities, parks, occasional Abu Dhabi attractions (Yas Waterworld, Ferrari World).
Premium shared room in upscale areas (Corniche, Al Reem Island towers). Frequent dining and entertainment. Organic Foods/Waitrose. Gym, beach clubs.
Luxury 1BHK in prime locations (Corniche, Saadiyat Island, Al Reem Island high-rises). High-end lifestyle with fine dining. Car ownership. Premium groceries and entertainment.

Premium 3-4BHK in luxury areas (Saadiyat Island, Yas Island, Corniche). International school fees NOT included (add AED 50,000-120,000/year per child). Two cars. Regular fine dining, beach club memberships, travel.

MOH-licensed emirate. Most affordable UAE option. Shared rooms in Al Nahda, Al Majaz, Rolla. Public buses to Dubai (if working cross-emirate, add 1 hour commute). Very budget-friendly for maximum savings.

1BHK in outer Sharjah (Al Nahda, Muweilah, Al Khan). Significantly cheaper than Dubai/Abu Dhabi. Car useful but not essential. Many Indian doctors choose Sharjah for cost savings while working in Dubai.
2-3BHK in family areas (Al Nahda, University City, Al Majaz). Family car recommended. Groceries at wholesale markets (Sharjah Mega Mall, Safeer). Very cost-effective for families saving aggressively.
Better-located shared accommodation (Al Majaz, Al Qasba, Al Khan Corniche). Some dining out and social activities. Mix of public transport and taxis.
1BHK in better areas (Al Majaz, Al Taawun, Corniche). Balanced lifestyle with occasional dining out. Car useful for Dubai commute (if applicable). Entertainment budget included.
2-3BHK in popular areas (Al Majaz, Al Taawun, Muweilah). Family car for convenience. Weekend activities in Sharjah (cheaper than Dubai attractions). Good balance of savings and comfort.
Premium shared accommodation in upscale Sharjah areas (Al Majaz waterfront, Al Qasba). Regular dining and entertainment. Higher quality lifestyle while maintaining cost advantage over Dubai.
Luxury 1BHK in prime Sharjah locations (Al Majaz waterfront, Al Khan). High-quality lifestyle at significantly lower cost than Dubai/Abu Dhabi Premium. Car ownership, regular dining out.

Premium 3-4BHK in top Sharjah developments (Al Majaz, Maryam Island). International/private school fees NOT included (AED 20,000-60,000/year - cheaper than Dubai). Family car. Regular dining, activities. Best premium lifestyle value in UAE.
